trait.name: Age
trait.text: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
To set your height and weight randomly, start with rolling a size modifier:
Size modifier = 2d10 Height = 4 feet + 8 inches + your size modifier in inches Weight in pounds = 110 + (2d4 × your size modifier)

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Or, if your campaign uses the optional rules for languages found in the previous section, your national origin determines your native language: Itzocan for the Sun Empire, Coalition pidgin for the Brazen Coalition, or Vampire for the Legion of Dusk. You still speak one additional language of your choice, and Common if it exists in your campaign.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
The River Heralds are merfolk—a race of amphibious humanoids at home throughout the oceans, rivers, and rain forests of Ixalan. They stand between seven and eight feet tall, with skin that ranges from deep burgundy through many shades of violet and blue, to green, bright orange, and yellow. They are humanlike in shape, but have long fins extending from their shoulders, forearms, middle backs, and calves. Frills of fins also protrude from the backs of their heads. All merfolk can breathe air or filter oxygen from the water, and they can walk on land or swim with equal ease.
Blue merfolk often have burgundy or magenta on their faces and chests, with lighter shades of blue and purple elsewhere. Their eyes are red, orange, or blue, and their long, thin, and elegant fins resemble scarves or veils of fine fabric. They swim easily, even upstream, and clamber over rocks and through rapids with ease. They prefer to dwell in shallow waters, but spend a fair amount of time on land as well.
Source: Plane Shift: Ixalan p. 12

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most merfolk are neutral, living in close harmony with nature.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Merfolk are significantly taller than most humans, standing between seven and eight feet tall and averaging about 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Swimming
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Lore of the Waters
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the History and Nature skills.

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign), Merfolk, and one additional language of your choice.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
The River Heralds are merfolk—a race of amphibious humanoids at home throughout the oceans, rivers, and rain forests of Ixalan. They stand between seven and eight feet tall, with skin that ranges from deep burgundy through many shades of violet and blue, to green, bright orange, and yellow. They are humanlike in shape, but have long fins extending from their shoulders, forearms, middle backs, and calves. Frills of fins also protrude from the backs of their heads. All merfolk can breathe air or filter oxygen from the water, and they can walk on land or swim with equal ease.
Green merfolk generally have yellow chests and pale green faces, shading to dark blues and purples on their backs and limbs. The patterns on their skin suggest the colors of the tree frogs common in the rain forest, as do their eyes of orange, lime green, or sky blue. Their fins are relatively short and thick. They climb trees with ease, move through undergrowth unhindered, and often wield magic to shape vines and branches to their will.
Source: Plane Shift: Ixalan p. 12

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most merfolk are neutral, living in close harmony with nature.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Merfolk are significantly taller than most humans, standing between seven and eight feet tall and averaging about 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Swimming
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the druid spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign), Merfolk, and one additional language of your choice.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Orcs originally came from the same mountainous region where the kingdom of Torrezon was born, and they have been enemies of the Legion of Dusk since it was originally formed. The entire race has been declared anathema by the Church of Torrezon, and after centuries of fighting the Legion, the orcs have dwindled to only a few hundred in number. Some still live on remote islands near Torrezon, but many have joined the Brazen Coalition to serve on pirate ships—taking on any role that calls for an abundance of sheer muscle. Orcs are tall, standing head and shoulders above most humans, and are generally twice as broad. They often accentuate their bulging muscles by wearing tight-fitting bands and accessories around the thickest parts of their arms and necks. Their skin color ranges from light brown through gray to almost jet-black.
Source: Plane Shift: Ixalan p. 15

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most orcs lean toward chaotic alignments, and many serve on pirate ships that encourage an inclination toward evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Orcs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.
To set your height and weight randomly, start with rolling a size modifier:
Size modifier = 2d8 Height = 5 feet + 4 inches + your size modifier in inches Weight in pounds = 175 + (2d6 × your size modifier)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Menacing
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
trait.text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Savage Attacks
trait.text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Orc.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Sirens are at home along the waters of the Stormwreck Sea. They settle on rocky coasts and remote islands, and even on floating piles of kelp. Sirens are mercurial creatures who can turn in an instant from lonely to repulsed, from desirous to hateful, from welcoming to irritated, from loving to murderous—and then back again. They are fascinated with ships, and enjoy toying with them. One siren might call out to a passing crew for company, only to capriciously draw the ship into an entangling mass of kelp. Another might lure a vessel onto jagged rocks so as to study the wreckage and learn more about the strange contraption. But as the number of Brazen Coalition ships passing through siren-controlled waters has increased over the years, a growing number of sirens have decided to satisfy their curiosity by taking positions on ship crews—including, in at least one case, the position of captain. Sirens are humanoid creatures with birdlike features. Their long, slender arms extend into powerful wings that easily carry their light frames into the air. Their fingers bear sharp claws but are nimble enough to wield weapons and perform fine manipulation. Crests of feathery plumage start between their eyes and cover the backs of their heads.
Source: Plane Shift: Ixalan p. 17

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most sirens lean toward chaotic alignment, cherishing the freedom and independence that comes from joining a pirate crew.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Sirens stand about 5 to 6 feet tall, but their bodies are slender and their bones partially hollow to facilitate their flight. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. You can't use your flying speed while you wear medium or heavy armor. (If your campaign uses the variant rule for encumbrance, you can't use your flying speed if you are encumbered.)

trait.name: Siren's Song
trait.text: You know the friends cantrip and can cast it without material components.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Siren.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Vampires are associated with necromancy. Their existence is predicated on draining the life from others to fuel their own existence, and on putting their own lives ahead of all other concerns. Philosophically, they do not constrain themselves with artificial rules of morality, but believe that the strong can and should take what they need from the weak.
The Legion of Dusk is dominated by an aristocratic class made up of vampires. They are faster and stronger than most humans, and gifted with supernatural abilities that made them the most formidable force in their homeland. Now, as they push into the depths of Ixalan in search of the Immortal Sun, they bring this strength to bear against all who would resist their advance. For many vampires, the Rite of Redemption that transforms a human into a vampire is an act of personal sacrifice, paving the way for a promised glorious age. These vampires embody Torrezon's noble tradition in Ixalan. They are often guided by their dual loyalties to church and crown, believing that the monarch acts with righteous purpose. As such, these vampires carry themselves with a self-assurance that is both imposing and imperial. Other societies seem inferior and unclean compared to their own, leading them to feel that they have a right to claim new lands despite the presence of people already inhabiting those lands. Other vampires view vampirism merely as a means to attain a powerful advantage over others. These vampires are fierce, ruthless, and often cruel, relishing conflict—be it political or armed—as a means of demonstrating their superiority. Many are politically ambitious, invoking Torrezon's hierarchy when it serves their interests, but ignoring all the rules of church, state, and morality when those rules become a burden. When these vampires come to Ixalan, they are conquerors, motivated by the prospect of personal glory and the accumulation of riches. Those who achieve wealth and power display it ostentatiously. The core of every vampire's nature is the Feast of Blood. Though it is forbidden to feed on human citizens of Torrezon, including the human sailors and servants who accompany the vampire conquistadors to Ixalan, vampires are encouraged to feed on outsiders and heretics. The Feast of Blood sends new life essence flowing through the vampire who partakes of it, manifesting as even greater strength and speed.
Source: Plane Shift: Ixalan p. 14

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Vampires don't mature and age in the same way that other races do.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Vampires might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many of them end up there. Evil or not, their strict hierarchies incline them toward a lawful alignment.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Vampires are the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Vampiric Resistance
trait.text: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Bloodthirst
trait.text: You can drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is grappled by you, incapacitated, or restrained. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces it's hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Feast of Blood
trait.text: When you drain blood with your Bloodthirst ability, you experience a surge of vitality. Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws for 1 minute.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Vampire.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Following the devastation of the distant continent of Otaria in Karona's War some two and a half centuries ago, people of many races left that land to find refuge elsewhere. Among them were the birdlike people called aven, who were largely unknown outside of Otaria prior to their exodus. Rather than dispersing around the world and assimilating into local cultures, they wandered in great flocks, forming separate communities in a few hospitable locations. The largest such flock settled in Benalia, where its people submitted themselves to Benalish law in exchange for hospitality. The aven have no representation on the Council of Seven, but many hope to see that change. Aven have humanlike bodies, arms, and legs, along with birdlike wings and heads. Two distinct varieties of aven are found in Naktamun. One has the head of a hawk or similar bird of prey, with short wings allowing fast flight. The other variety has the head of an ibis atop a long neck, with wide, angular wings better suited to soaring. All aven have lean bodies with feathers extending from their heads down to their shoulders. Aven delight in flying above their foes, using their superior mobility to confound and outpace their opponents. They love soaring through the sky as well, though the Hekma limits their altitude. Like all people of Naktamun, they are grateful for the Hekma's protective magic, of course. But they keenly anticipate the hour when the God-Pharaoh will return and dissolve the veil, letting them fly without limit in the afterlife.
Source: Plane Shift: Dominaria p. 6

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Like humans, aven reach adulthood in their late teens and can live into their 80s.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Aven are inclined toward the lawful good alignment of the Church of Serra

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Aven stand from 5 to 6 feet tall, but their bodies are slender and their bones are partially hollow to facilitate their flight. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. You can't use your flying speed while you wear medium or heavy armor. (If your campaign uses the variant rule for encumbrance, you can't use your flying speed if you are encumbered.)

trait.name: Hawkeyed
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill. In addition, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Aven.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
The people of Keld are human, but they are like no other humans anywhere. Nearly all adults stand over six feet tall, and heights above seven feet are not uncommon. They are massively muscled and have gray skin, ranging from an ashy gray-white to a deeper bluegray. The typical Keldon's hairline points sharply down in the middle of the forehead and at either temple, but recedes elsewhere—sometimes dramatically. Keldons are remarkably resistant to the cold of their homeland, baring skin even in near-freezing temperatures without discomfort. Keldons value self-reliance, strength, and courage above all else. Anything that is the product of their own labor is a fine thing. Anything else is treated with a healthy dose of skepticism. At best, they are a proud, pragmatic, passionate people, and their loyalty is fierce once earned. At worst, they can be reckless, hot-tempered, and violent—and no small number of Keldons still consider these qualities virtues rather than vices. Because of their many exploits as both conquerors and mercenaries, Keldons appear in the legends and histories of other peoples across the world. Sometimes these tales are exaggerated—but many that sound exaggerated are not.
Source: Plane Shift: Dominaria

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Keldons reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Keldons tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Keldons are taller and heavier than the human norms of other cultures, standing almost universally above 6 feet tall and reaching heights above 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Natural Athlete
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

trait.name: Keldon Resilience
trait.text: You have proficiency in Strength saving throws

trait.name: Icehaven Born
trait.text: You are naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Keldon.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Ahh the Dankwood goblins! I have adventured far and wide in my time and never have I met such unique and interesting goblins as these. Perhaps it is the magical nature of the Dankwood itself as this forest was once rumored to have been the ancient sanctum of a powerful Netherese wizard, but who is to say? This world is a wondrous one and everywhere you go, something new is there to dazzle and amaze! —Guardian Leafy Skiptoes
Dankwood goblins are much like any other run-of-the-mill goblin but they are much more gentle and artistic than the savage and uncouth goblins of the world. They are inquisitive and have a magical bond with the small forest creatures with which they are often friends. They are fast and nimble and love to explore. Because of this they make great adventurers and guides.
Source: Adventure with Muk p. 35, Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 174

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Goblins reach adulthood at age 8 and live up to 60 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Dankwood goblins are typically neutral or neutral good, though some mischievous dankwood goblins are chaotic neutral.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Goblins are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 80 pounds. Your size is Small.
To set your height and weight randomly, start with rolling a size modifier:
Size modifier = 2d4 Height = 3 feet + 5 inches + your size modifier in inches Weight in pounds = 35 + your size modifier

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Speak with Small Beasts
trait.text: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Dankwood goblins love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Cave bullywugs have made their home in the deep places underground. They tend to be dark brown, olive green, light blue or even pigment-free albinos. Their eyes are pale in color, and their eyesight is adapted to the complete lack of sunlight in underground living. They are excellent scavengers and can survive on meager resources.
Source: Bullywugs p. 6 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Social Structure
trait.text:
Bullywug civilizations have a loose class system organized within a tribe-like framework. Warriors, gatherers, tadpole caretakers, shaman, and builders are typical classes in a bullywug society. They are governed by a king or queen, who is usually the largest and strongest of the warrior caste. The royalty rules according to their attitude and morality, which can range from a friendly monarchy to a hostile dictatorship.
There are a few bullywug towns that are more advanced; some boasting studies in mathematics, physics, metalworking, and engineering. There are even rumors of a few bullywug castles guarded by heavily armored knights. Wealthy kings and queens are waited on by servants and peasants, following more feudalistic-like social organization.

trait.name: Adaptions
trait.text:
Bullywugs survive in many different living conditions: untamed jungles, lush forests, wetlands, and even deep underground. As such, their bodies have also adapted to suit these conditions, producing an incredible amount of variety in size, color, and ability.
Bullywugs usually thrive near water. Their strong legs and long, webbed feet make them wonderful swimmers, but hinder their movement on land. They developed their ability to jump as a result, so they can chase down their quarry, or escape a predator.
Bullywugs can pass air through their throats, filling a flexible membrane that bellows out and amplifies their noise. They can speak with one another up to 500 feet away.

trait.name: Reasons to Adventure
trait.text:
Greed is the compelling reason to adventure. A clanless bullywug feels free to take for themselves, instead of for a king or queen. Initially, their hunger for the accumulation of wealth is ravenous. As they become used to their freedom, this can dissipate. However, some set out to find treasure for their ruler, in the hopes of achieving a higher social rank on their return.
The quest for power is a hallmark of the bullywug social order. Finding power in personal strength, wealth, or magical ability fits in nicely with bullywug aspirations.
There are a few "free thinking" bullywugs who adventure for other reasons, such as giving money to charity, defending friends or their town, or overthrowing local evil.

trait.name: Bullywug Names
trait.text:
Bullywugs have names that contain clicks, growls, and throaty, raspy consonant sounds.
Examples of bullywug names: Kek'kek, Jrr'mya, Krr'mit, Budd, Wyyze, Err, and Rrr'bet.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Bullywugs are considered full-grown at 3 years of age. The average lifespan of a bullywug is 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Bullywugs can be of any alignment, but tend to be chaotic and evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Your size is Medium, however bullywugs vary in size and weight. Most are about 4 to 5 feet tall and weight 80 to 120 pounds.

trait.name: Swim speed
trait.text: You have a base swimming speed of 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The large, circular eardrum behind your eyes is extremely sensitive to sound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in Dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colros in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.text:

The horned bullywugs are larger than most bullywugs, and are green or tan, with brown spots. They have unique horn-like projections that protrude over the tops of their eyes, often resulting in an intimidating appearance.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:

trait.name: Poison Darts
trait.text: You are proficient with darts and blowguns. You can apply poison to a number of darts or blowgun darts up to your Charisma modifier by rubbing them on your skin. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to DC 10 + your Charisma modifier or take 1d4 + your Charisma modifier poison damage.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Toad bullywugs are the largest of all bullywugs. Their drab, dry, bumpy skin and bloated features also make them the ugliest of the bullywugs. What they lack in beauty, they make up for in sheer toughness.
Source: Bullywugs p. 6 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Social Structure
trait.text:
Bullywug civilizations have a loose class system organized within a tribe-like framework. Warriors, gatherers, tadpole caretakers, shaman, and builders are typical classes in a bullywug society. They are governed by a king or queen, who is usually the largest and strongest of the warrior caste. The royalty rules according to their attitude and morality, which can range from a friendly monarchy to a hostile dictatorship.
There are a few bullywug towns that are more advanced; some boasting studies in mathematics, physics, metalworking, and engineering. There are even rumors of a few bullywug castles guarded by heavily armored knights. Wealthy kings and queens are waited on by servants and peasants, following more feudalistic-like social organization.

trait.name: Adaptions
trait.text:
Bullywugs survive in many different living conditions: untamed jungles, lush forests, wetlands, and even deep underground. As such, their bodies have also adapted to suit these conditions, producing an incredible amount of variety in size, color, and ability.
Bullywugs usually thrive near water. Their strong legs and long, webbed feet make them wonderful swimmers, but hinder their movement on land. They developed their ability to jump as a result, so they can chase down their quarry, or escape a predator.
Bullywugs can pass air through their throats, filling a flexible membrane that bellows out and amplifies their noise. They can speak with one another up to 500 feet away.

trait.name: Reasons to Adventure
trait.text:
Greed is the compelling reason to adventure. A clanless bullywug feels free to take for themselves, instead of for a king or queen. Initially, their hunger for the accumulation of wealth is ravenous. As they become used to their freedom, this can dissipate. However, some set out to find treasure for their ruler, in the hopes of achieving a higher social rank on their return.
The quest for power is a hallmark of the bullywug social order. Finding power in personal strength, wealth, or magical ability fits in nicely with bullywug aspirations.
There are a few "free thinking" bullywugs who adventure for other reasons, such as giving money to charity, defending friends or their town, or overthrowing local evil.

trait.name: Bullywug Names
trait.text:
Bullywugs have names that contain clicks, growls, and throaty, raspy consonant sounds.
Examples of bullywug names: Kek'kek, Jrr'mya, Krr'mit, Budd, Wyyze, Err, and Rrr'bet.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Bullywugs are considered full-grown at 3 years of age. The average lifespan of a bullywug is 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Bullywugs can be of any alignment, but tend to be chaotic and evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Your size is Medium, however bullywugs vary in size and weight. Most are about 4 to 5 feet tall and weight 80 to 120 pounds.

trait.name: Swim speed
trait.text: You have a base swimming speed of 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The large, circular eardrum behind your eyes is extremely sensitive to sound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Sticky Tongue
trait.text: Your long, sticky tongue lets you grab items that are up to 10 feet away. Furthermore, it gives you advantage when initiating a grappling attack action.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Tree bullywugs have light-green bodies, with bright red eyes and orange feet. They have slender, sleek builds and long fingers that make them adapt climbers.
Source: Bullywugs p. 5 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Adept Climber
trait.text: Using all four of your appendages, you can climb up, down and across vertical surfaces, and upside-down along ceilings.

trait.name: Tree Bullywug Weapon Training
trait.text: Being from the forest, you have proficiency with the following wooden weapons: clubs, greatclubs, shortbows and longbows.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
This is a rebalance and reenvisioning of the original Aaracokra race, which can be found in the Elemental Evil Player's Companion, and on the Wizards of the Coast and DNDBeyond websites for free. This version introduces subraces.
This subrace represents the original version of the aarakocra race. For more information on this version's culture, history, and archetypal adventurers, see the Elemental Evil Player's Companion, available for free on the Wizards of the Coast and DNDBeyond websites.
Source: Tasha's Crucible of Everything Else - Volume 2 p. 46 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increases
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2. Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Aarakocra reach maturity by age 3. Compared to humans, aarakocra don't usually live longer than 30 years.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Most mature Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.
You can roll to randomly determine your character's height and weight.
Size Modifier = 2d10 Height = 4 feet + 2 inches + your size modifier in inches Weight in Pounds = 80 + your size modifier

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

trait.name: Talons
trait.text: Your talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra and Auran.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Adapted to extremely cold environments, penguin aarakocra are completely at home in what most others would consider frigid wastelands. Unable to fly like the majority of their avian comrades, penguin aara- kocra are instead fantastic swimmers. Even the fastest avian aarakocra admit that the penguin breed poses a suitable challenge when they take to the water.
Source: Tasha's Crucible of Everything Else - Volume 2 p. 46 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increases
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2. Your Constitution or Charisma score (your choice) increases by 1.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Aarakocra reach maturity by age 3. Compared to humans, aarakocra don't usually live longer than 30 years.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Most mature Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.
You can roll to randomly determine your character's height and weight.
Size Modifier = 2d10 Height = 4 feet + 2 inches + your size modifier in inches Weight in Pounds = 80 + your size modifier

trait.name: Nautical
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

trait.name: Insulation
trait.text: You have a layer of fat and thick downy waterproof feathers. These give you resistance to cold damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: You can hold your breath for up to 20 minutes at a time.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra and Aquan.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
A generally ponderous and thoughtful bunch, condor aarakocra are known for their wise words, though their proverbs always seem to imply reminders of death. Not as fast as some of the other aarakocra, a condor aarakocra's strong points include a very hardy constitution and impressive longevity instead.
Source: Tasha's Crucible of Everything Else - Volume 2 p. 47 (Homebrew)
